description.narrative: The program provided humanitarian assistance to internally displaced and conflict-affected families internally displaced and conflict-affected families in Sudan. Families received cash for the purchase of food and/or vegetable seeds allowing for more varied diet and income from sale at local markets. New internally displaced families receive relief items (tarpaulins, mosquito nets, soap) to cover basic needs. Local communities and women's groups received training etc. in own protection, rights and mental health. In addition, the intervention supported: Local networks of barefoot vets and drugs for livestock; school materials for six schools and support and access to exams for older students; as well as support and training of staff of local health clinics. Also, the program supports a small secretariat for a consortium of implementing humanitarian organizations in the conflict zone. The secretariat aims to ensure effective and coordinated transport, information sharing and advocacy work. Finally, the program supported capacity building of local partners and local authorities. The program is supported by Danida and other donors.
